WRITING.TITLE: An interesting take on Love
[Serious] Have you ever had mental/threatening neighbours? How did you deal with them?
WRITING.TEXT: I've got really volatile neighbours who are verbally abusive and threatening and not sure how to deal with it. Have you ever had a similar experience, how did you handle them?

WRITING.TITLE: SIGNING FOR DEAF (WITH TRANSLATION FOR DUMB)

WRITING.TEXT:
This is what kills me, I like my job. I have a fun job and I'm good at it. It pays alright and my boss even supports me doing comedy but the reality is it's exhausting, I am knackered all the fucking time. I barely see my friends, I have just enough time to see my girlfriend and I can't motivate myself to write more. When I get in from a full week of work and gigging then turn on the TV I instantly feel like I'm being lazy and holding myself back but fuck I've just worked all week I need a beer and to zone out, not to go to a coffee shop and sit there for 3 hours staring at blank paper.
...and this is why I fear I'll never make it.

WRITING.TITLE: Considering how full of shit British Politicians are, it's quite refreshing to see a party leader open himself up to ridicule on TV. The Alex Brooker/Nick Clegg showdown on The Last Leg
As a stand up who still has a day job this Onion article was one of the most depressing thing I've ever read, also it's pretty funny.

WRITING.TEXT: And this one https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gZWsz9Duk34
My exact thoughts
I've read the books but it was a while ago, so I'm a bit hazy on it all. Which bit are you referring to here?

WRITING.TITLE: Charlie Hebdo Attack Rant - The Last Leg

WRITING.TEXT: My brother used to do this me when we were kids. We'd be asked to clean the dishes after dinner and he'd put a knife on the counter and bet me he could win a fight with just a spoon. Obviously I wasn't willing to stab my brother so he'd just hit the shit out of me with a spoon and then brag about it afterwards. Son of bitch hurt like hell.
The Ispooninati!
You're right. I had never noticed that before. Then again he is a hobbit himself so other than large feet it goes to reason the rest of him would be tiny.

WRITING.TITLE: Employee fired in under 3 minutes in epic fashion on UK doc "The Complainers". Imagine working for this c*nt!

WRITING.TEXT: I love these guys, I saw "Randy Is Sober" at Edinburgh 2 years ago, a show by just the puppet about how he kicked his alcohol addiction and it was fucking hilarious. It was really heartfelt and deep but coming from a purple puppet made it so surreal. They're amazing live.
Amazing! Thank you so much.

WRITING.TITLE: Jamie Redknapp and Robbie Fowler talk about sharing baths with John Barnes at Liverpool. Pretty funny.

WRITING.TEXT:
I've been buying bottles that range between 6-12 a bottle, so roughly the same price bracket, but I reckon these are the cheap variations. I've seen some Malbecs for over double that price but then again I'm sure you can always find a more expensive bottle somewhere.
The ones I had in Argentina were about 5 a bottle and they were sublime but it's a bit of a commute from London...

Thanks for the heads up, there's a large Majestic near work so I'll check that out. At the moment it's an after work purchase to go with dinner but I've just got myself a nice wine rack and figure I should fill it with nice wines in advance rather than just have whatever I could grab on the way home. I'll check out the Ben Marco.

WRITING.TITLE: Best affordable Malbec?
WRITING.TEXT: I live in the UK and I'm a complete wine novice however after a trip to Argentina I fell in love with Malbec wines, especially with a good steak. I'm currently trying an array of Malbecs, mostly from different supermarkets to try and find a great one but I was wondering if you guys have any tips or suggestions on a good, affordable Malbec?

WRITING.TITLE: Hugh Grant Re-Enacts Raining Four Weddings Scene on Graham Norton Show

WRITING.TEXT: What? You don't even what? WHAT DON'T YOU EVEN?!?
I just get a little bit of joy hearing Stephen Fry swear like that.

WRITING.TITLE: 4 Year Old Baffled By Nursery Rhyme
A cat adopts some baby ducklings. Now I'm a miserable c*nt but this melted my cold dark heart.

WRITING.TEXT: I see this video reposted all the time but every time I burst into work doing the "Brad Kelly" (at 3:11) no one ever seems to know what I'm doing... I hate my co-workers.

WRITING.TITLE: F1 Car vs Super Bike vs Power Boat

WRITING.TEXT: Cheers Marcus :)
Yeah just did a run at the Edinburgh Fringe and performed it 25 times. Some nights it felt like a lot of minutes and others it just flew by.
Ah that's a shame, my accent is a London/Essex one. I know I talk fast but didn't think I was unintelligible. Thanks for giving it a watch though.
This was my first solo hour show, I'd love to get some feedback and thoughts.
